item.title: Afghanistan: US fears risk of Islamic State attack at Kabul airport
item.description: A security alert is issued over "security threats" as thousands of people throng Kabul airport.

item.title: Hurricane Grace kills eight as it rips through eastern Mexico
item.description: The powerful storm brings torrential rain and high winds, causing power cuts and flooding.

item.title: Hurricane Henri: US East Coast warned of significant damage
item.description: New York state declares a state of emergency as officials warn of flooding and power outages.

item.title: Greece erects fence at Turkey border amid warnings of Afghan migrant surge
item.description: A 40km (25-mile) barrier is placed at the land border amid warnings of a surge of Afghan migrants.

item.title: Kenya holds biggest ever animal census
item.description: All wildlife on land and sea is being counted to help Kenya's conservation plans and tourism.

item.title: Covid: Australian police clash with anti-lockdown protesters
item.description: Hundreds of people are arrested after rallies against lockdown measures in Melbourne and Sydney.

item.title: Nigeria's royal wedding: Private jets, glitz and glamour
item.description: President Buhari's son marries the daughter of a religious leader in one of Nigeria's events of the year.

item.title: Poison algae may have killed California family, police say
item.description: A family of three may have been killed by toxic algae blooms on a hiking trail, investigators say.

item.title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: US accuses Abiy's government of blocking aid
item.description: Washington's aid chief says food is set to run out, with hundreds of thousands at risk of famine.

item.title: R. Kelly aide says he paid bribe for singer to marry Aaliyah
item.description: An ex-tour manager for the singer testifies that he obtained a fake ID for then 15-year-old Aaliyah.

item.title: Ever Given: Cargo ship returns through Suez Canal it blocked
item.description: Global trade was disrupted in March when the massive container ship became stuck in the waterway.

item.title: Haiti earthquake: Tensions rise in struggle to get aid to victims
item.description: Five days after a powerful earthquake struck, hundreds are missing and people are desperate for aid.

item.title: Dorothy Butler Gilliam: 'I am not a maid, I am a reporter'
item.description: The first black female reporter on the Washington Post says some colleagues would pretend not to know her.

item.title: Algeria's desperate wildfire fight: Buckets and branches
item.description: Despite a huge military budget, oil-rich Algeria is ill-equipped to tackle annual fires.

item.title: Africa's jihadists: What Taliban takeover of Afghanistan means
item.description: Islamist groups appear emboldened by the fall of Afghanistan, sparking concern in African countries.

item.title: Computer Space and beyond: 50 years of gaming
item.description: From an arcade game to a multi-billion pound industry, the BBC charts the ups and downs of video games.

item.title: 'They will kill me': Desperate Afghans seek way out after Taliban takeover
item.description: Many Afghans are desperate to escape after the Taliban takeover. Some fear there is no way out.

item.title: How Afghanistan's media is changing under Taliban rule
item.description: The Taliban are currently on a media offensive but does their rhetoric match whatâ€™s happening on the ground?

item.title: Simone Biles and mental health focus: 'I wouldn't change anything for the world'
item.description: Four-time Olympic gold medallist Simone Biles "wouldn't change anything for the world" because she "gave an outlet for athletes to speak up about mental health".

item.title: The devastating human cost of rising US gun violence
item.description: Deadly shootings are on the rise in many US cities - poorer and black communities are hardest hit.

item.title: 'I play carrom with my feet'
item.description: Twenty-three-year-old Harshad Gothankar was born without arms, but he is now a state carrom champion.

item.title: Drag Race UK queens: Covid 'pushed us creatively'
item.description: Newsbeat has spoken to all 12 queens taking part in the new series.

item.title: Afghanistan: The desperate scramble to escape
item.description: The BBC witnesses scenes of chaos and panic as thousands still crowd Kabul's airport.

item.title: Turmoil in Afghanistan hits close to home in America too
item.description: Christine's husband was killed in Afghanistan - she's horrified by the Taliban's return to power.

item.title: Biden's week of blame and tumult after Kabul fall
item.description: How the fall of Kabul stunned the Biden administration and spawned the worst week of his presidency.

item.title: Afghan crisis: Russia plans for new era with Taliban rule
item.description: While Western governments raced to get their people out, Russia appears unfazed by the takeover.

item.title: Family of American taken by Taliban beg for return
item.description: Mark Frerichs, 59, one of the last Americans kidnapped by the Taliban, is stuck in Afghanistan.
